title: Augusta County: Jedediah Hotchkiss to Sara A. Hotchkiss, May 10, 1863
summary: Hotchkiss describes the battle of Chancellorsville and its aftermath, death toll and prisoners taken. He reports that General Jackson's condition is worse, and that he is near death. He comments briefly on affairs at home.
keywords: Home Front, Church/Religious Activity, Military Authority, Death/Casualties, Medicine/Hospitals, Prisons/Prisoners, Battle Description, National Government, Women, African Americans, Slavery, Troop Movement, American Civil War
